intro: Moraea unibracteata, commonly known as the single-bract moraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in late summer to early autumn. Moraea unibracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
